title: Statistical analyses with missing data: developing, maintaining and promoting accessible resources for social scientists
abstractText:
Awareness of the issues raised by missing data in social science research, together with the possibility of addressing them using the method known as 'multiple imputation', is rising steeply among social and medical researchers. This is reflected in increasing interest in the research, training materials, software and courses described at www.missingdata.org.

The aim of this project is to maximise the impact and influence of the ESRC's previous and ongoing support of the applicants' research work in this area.  Specifically the researcher working on this project will:

  • support maintain and develop software for multilevel multiple imputation;
  • maintain and develop web resources;
  • assist with the delivery and support of workshops.

The project therefore enables the applicants to deliver ongoing support for the broad spectrum of researchers in the social and medical sciences involved in the statistical analysis of partially observed data.
organisation: London Sch of Hygiene and Trop Medicine
